meanings.definition: A person who believes in the concept of finitude.
meanings.sent1: The finitists in the group argued that everything has an end.
meanings.sent2: Many finitists study the idea of limits in philosophy.
meanings.sent3: The finitists at the party joked about reaching the edge of the universe.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a room with walls closing in, a concept the finitists understood well.
meanings.sent5: The image of a finite hourglass helped the students grasp the idea of finitists.

meanings.definition: Those who adhere to the belief that there are limits to knowledge or understanding.
meanings.sent1: As finitists, they acknowledged the boundaries of human comprehension.
meanings.sent2: The finitists discussed the constraints of scientific exploration.
meanings.sent3: The finitists playfully pondered the idea of a library with only a few books.
meanings.sent4: In a world of infinite possibilities, the finitists stood firm in their beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The concept of finitists was like a fence around the field of knowledge, keeping it contained.
